gettysburg.common

Interface Coordinate


  • public interface Coordinate

    The Coordinate represents the (x, y) reference to a particular Square on the board. Any of the functions described in this interface may be implemented by the Java Point class by either subclassing Point or wrapping a Point object. The important thing to note is that the only things that a client or service, like the GbgGame can rely on are the methods defined in this interface.

    For Gettysburg the origin (0, 0) is rooted at the upper left corner.

    If you need your component to have additional capabilities (which you very well might need) you should create copy constructors so that you can transform a Coordinate from a client into your implementation of a Coordinate.

    Version:
    Jun 8, 2017

      • getX

        the y-coordinate value

      • distanceTo

        default int distanceTo(Coordinate coordinate)
        Return the distance to the specified coordinate from this coordinate. This is the shortest distance calculated by a possible combination of moves in horizontal, vertical, and diagonal steps; each of these steps counting as a distance of 1.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - the target coordinate
        Returns:
        the distance to the target coordinate

      • directionTo

        default Direction directionTo(Coordinate coordinate)
        Given a target coordinate, return the direction of that coordinate relative to this coordinate. If the two coordinates do not lie in a straight line, or are the same coordinate, the result is NONE.
        Parameters:
        coordinate - the coordinate of the other coordinate relative to this
        Returns:
        the direction
